VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {5} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Solar relative to the peak of Hydroelectric in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Solar is to the {right} of the peak of Hydroelectric.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Wind show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Wind shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Geothermal reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Geothermal} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =55.9?
EVJ.A: At X =55.9,the label with the highest density is {Biomass}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 70? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NF.A: {Hydroelectric}'s peak at {20},{Geothermal}'s peak at {13},{Wind}'s peak at {8}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Biomass or Geothermal?
NC.A: {Biomass} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Wind or Solar?
NC.A: {Solar} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Geothermal or Hydroelectric?
NC.A: {Hydroelectric} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Wind or Biomass?
NC.A: {Biomass} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {1} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Geothermal}
